references.paper_title: How much data is sufficient to learn high-performing algorithms? generalization guarantees for data-driven algorithm design
references.reason: This paper provides the theoretical foundation for data-driven algorithm design, which is the basis of the current research.

references.paper_title: Improved sample complexity bounds for branch-and-cut
references.reason: This paper establishes tighter sample complexity bounds for the branch-and-cut algorithm, improving upon existing results in the field.
This paper addresses the problem of algorithm selection from a portfolio, which is relevant to the context of selecting algorithms based on instances.

references.paper_title: Sample complexity of tree search configuration: Cutting planes and beyond
references.reason: This paper extends the analysis of sample complexity to more general settings of branch-and-cut, including cut selection strategies.

references.paper_title: Adaptive cut selection in mixed-integer linear programming
references.reason: This paper explores the use of machine learning techniques for cut selection in mixed-integer linear programming, providing a relevant comparison to the current method.
